commit.message:
Made test_idle_thread_reuse more reliable (#92)

Depending on machine load or other unknown influences
on the Linux scheduler, this would often fail with

   File "test_futures.py", line 558, in test_idle_thread_reuse
     self.assertEqual(len(executor._threads), 1)
 AssertionError: 2 != 1
Updated the changelog
Add thread initializer (from Python 3.7) (#93)
Reinforced the test suite against PyPy garbage collection issues
Fixed the Python 2.6 test run

Don't spin up new threads if there are existing idle ones

Fixes #88.

Upgraded the Python 3 warnings

Since some users have ignored the warnings and tried to use this on Python 3, the warning has been changed to a hard failure when running setup.py on py3. The README now also reflects this.
More detailed warning towards Python2 users (#75)
Fix typo in changelog (#72)
Fixed alignment error in README.rst
Bumped up the version number
Modernized the packaging/testing setup

Renamed CHANGES to CHANGES.rst

It was in rst format to begin with, but this allows Github to format
it properly when people look at it.
Corrected minor details in packaging metadata
Added a README
Fixed tests hanging on PyPy
Added notes from PR #66

Backport fixes to as_completed and map iterators (bpo-27144) (#66)

Python issues:

+ python/cpython#1560
+ python/cpython#3270
+ python/cpython#3830
Specify python_requires to prevent installation on Python 3 (#67)
Wrap long lines in CHANGES. (#61)

Make Future.__repr__ subclass-friendly (bpo-22033) (#65)

+ https://bugs.python.org/issue22033

Minor spelling fixes in docstrings (bpo-25523)

+ https://bugs.python.org/issue25523

Backport `thread_name_prefix` from upstream (#64)

Changes from https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/2315

Fixes #63.
Bumped up the version number

Switched to the PSF license

The original backport may have been licensed under the BSD license but the new backport was completely done using code from the standard library.
Thus licensing it using the BSD license was probably never a valid option.
Fixes #53.
Mention old-style exception support in CHANGES. (#60)

Add support for old-style exception objects. (#58)

Python 2 permits raising old-style objects (objects that aren't
instances of the object class).  Because these objects are not
instances of BaseException, clauses like 'except BaseException:'
don't catch them.

Add support for handling old-style exception objects by:

  * using a class-less 'except:' clause to catch old-style objects
    raised by tasks and done callbacks
  * using the proper exception object class type when raising a stored
    old-type exception during result()
docs: fix typo (#59)
Added Travis configuration
Backported max_workers changes from upstream
Fixed OverflowError with ProcessPoolExecutor on Windows
